column1: Early on the following morning he reached Portsmouth; and
column2: having despatched his business on shore
column3: endeavoured to elude the populace by taking a by-way to the beach; but a crowd collected in his train
column4: pressing forward to obtain a sight of his face;—many were in tears
column5: and many knelt down before him
column6: and blessed him as he passed. England has had many heroes
column7: but never one who so entirely possessed the love of his fellow-countrymen as Nelson. All men knew that his heart was as humane as it was fearless; that there was not in his nature the slightest alloy of selfishness or cupidity; but that
column9: he served his country with all his heart
column11: and with all his strength; and
column13: they loved him as truly and as fervently as he loved England. They pressed upon the parapet to gaze after him when his barge pushed off
column14: and he was returning their cheers by waving his hat.
